src:
Bangganya Jokowi soal Ekonomi RI: Alhamdulillah Tumbuh 5%
06 Nov 2019, 04:41 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: (Dok Biro Pers Setpres).

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) masih merasa bangga atas pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia yang tetap konsisten di level 5%. Angka pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional masih lebih bagus dibandingkan dengan negara-negara lain yang mengalami penurunan.Bahkan, Jokowi mengaku telah diberikan masukan dari IMF agar Pemerintahan kabinet Indonesia Maju bisa mengelola kebijakan fiskal dan moneter dengan lebih baik di tengah perlambatan ekonomi dunia."Dunia growth hampir semuanya turun dan alhamdulillah kita masih diberi angka (tumbuh) 5(%) lebih dikit, nggak banyak, lebih dikit," kata Jokowi saat membuka acara Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) merilis angka pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia sebesar 5,02 persen pada kuartal III-2019. Angka ini jauh lebih rendah dari kuartal III-2018 sebesar 5,17%.Meski mengalai perlambatan, Jokowi menjelaskan bahwa perlambatan tersebut tidak sedalam yang dialami berbagai negara dunia."5 sudah bagus dibandingkan dengan negara-negara lain, ada yang sudah minus, menuju ke 0, berkurang 1,5, 1, 2%, ada yang dulu berada di angka 7 menjadi di bawah 1, ini patut kita syukuri, kita harus bersyukur, sekali lagi kita punya potensi menjadi negara yang berpenghasilan tinggi dan kita semuanya berharap agar kita bisa keluar dari jebakan negara berpenghasilan menengah, namun ada beberapa agenda mendesak yang harus kita lakukan," jelas dia.Simak Video "Menerka Tim Ekonomi di Kabinet Baru Jokowi"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hek/fdl)
text:
Jokowi's Pride on Indonesia's Economy: Thank God Grows by 5%
Nov 6 2019, 04:41 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: (Dok Setpres Press Bureau).

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) still feels proud of Indonesia's economic growth which remains consistent at the 5% level. The national economic growth rate is still better than other countries that experienced a decline. In fact, Jokowi claimed to have been given input from the IMF so that the Government of the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet could better manage fiscal and monetary policies amid a slowdown in the world economy. "World growth is almost everything goes down and thank God we are still given a number (growing) 5 (%) a little more, not a lot, a little more, "Jokowi said when opening the Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 at the Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday (6/11/2019). The Statistics Center (BPS) released Indonesia's economic growth rate of 5.02 percent in the third quarter of 2019. This figure is much lower than the third quarter of 2018 of 5.17%. Even though the slowdown is underway, Jokowi explained that the slowdown was not as deep as that experienced by various world countries. to 0, reduced by 1.5, 1, 2%, some were in the number 7 to be under 1, we should be grateful, we must be grateful, once again we have the potential to become a high-income country and we all hope that we can get out of the trap of middle-income countries, but there are some urgent agendas that we have to do, "he explained. Watch Video" Interrogate the Economic Team in Jokowi's New Cabinet "[Gambas: Video 20seconds]
